organizations.name: Labor Party
quotes: Born in Oslo in 1939, Brundtland's early exposure to politics and health, influenced by her family's involvement in the Labor Party, shaped her career trajectory.
Labor Party member and medical doctor Brundtland was elected Norway’s first female prime minister, and its youngest.
the daughter of two prominent Labor Party members, Swedish-born Inga Brynolf and Norwegian Gudmund Harlem.
When just seven years old, Gro joined the Progress Group, the Norwegian children’s Labor Party.
